questions.text: Where are Jerry and Elaine in the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
St. Louis

	Jerry had to fly down to St. Louis for a gig and he was given an extra ticket.  Elaine was chosen to go down with him, and she got to see her sister.  George and Kramer planned to pick Elaine and Jerry up at the airport in New York.

questions.text: Where does the baggage officer end up sending Elaine's suitcase?
questions.explanation:
Honolulu.

	Jerry and Elaine were unsure about how much they should tip the guy at the baggage drop-off, so they asked him.  He told them he gets about five dollars per bag, and Elaine is shocked at the amount.  Although Jerry pays the man his tip, Elaine gets frustrated and yells at the guy, so he sends her bag thousands of miles away.

questions.text: Jerry offers Elaine the first-class seat.
questions.explanation:
False.

	When their flight is canceled, Elaine and Jerry are forced to fly to LaGuardia Airport instead of JFK.  Since their flight was canceled, the ticket prices for their seats are the same, but there's one seat in coach, and one in first-class.  Jerry says that he needs to take the first-class seat because he can't go back knowing what he's going to miss.

questions.text: What row is Elaine sitting in on the plane?
questions.explanation:
Third row.

	Since she's in coach, Elaine is having a horrible time while Jerry is having a first-class treatment eating sundaes and drinking champagne.  Elaine tries to sneak into first-class at one point, but she's forced back into coach.

questions.text: What is the profession of the woman sitting next to Jerry on the plane?
questions.explanation:
Model.

	Once again, Jerry has a stroke of luck because he's seated next to a beautiful model.  During the flight, she happens to show a picture of herself in a magazine where she's just getting out of the shower.  In the end, the two exchange numbers.

questions.text: What magazine does George purchase in the airport?
questions.explanation:
Time.

	George wants to read the magazine because there's supposed to be an article about Jerry in it and his name may have been mentioned.  In the gift shop, George ends up taking the last copy seconds before a convict is about to pick it up.  Later in the episode, the convict gets his revenge.

questions.text: What happens when Elaine goes to the bathroom on the plane?
questions.explanation:
Her seat gets blocked.

	Elaine tries to hold it in for a while, but she soon decides to go to the bathroom.  When she leaves it, the food cart is blocking the aisle and she can't return to her seat.  When she finally gets back to her seat, all of the meals have been given out, except hers.  While she's in the bathroom, the pilot tells everyone that they're actually going to turn around and land at JFK.

questions.text: In first-class, the passengers are being served wine.  What region is the wine from?
questions.explanation:
Tuscany.

	While Elaine is struggling to return to her seat, Jerry and Tia, the model, are being served their dinner.  Elaine is served the Kosher meal, but Jerry's contains Chateaubriand and Poached Over Sole in White Wine Sauce with Saffron.

questions.text: Kramer buys refundable plane tickets in this episode.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Kramer wants to board a plane in order to get money from a guy who apparently owed it to him twenty years ago.  He tells George to give him a credit card so that he can buy a ticket and get a refund when he's gotten his money.  Kramer ends up buying two non-refundable tickets that George has to pay for.

questions.text: Who is not in the airport in the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
George.

	Kramer ends up not getting his money, Elaine's luggage ends up in Honolulu, and George ends up accidentally taking the plane that Kramer bought tickets for.  Jerry is the only one to have had a good night.
